pageContext.claim: “Wow. This is exactly what happened to us. Great courage by judge!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump tweeted this over a 1994 New York Times article, which reported how a federal judge had taken the rare step of invalidating a Pennsylvania state senate election tainted by absentee-ballot fraud by Democrats and ordered the seat filled by the Republican candidate. The judge found that, through an elaborate fraud, hundreds of residents were encouraged to vote by absentee ballot even though they had no legal reason to. But this was an exceedingly rare case of absentee-ballot fraud and the judge's remedy -- tossing out all absentee ballots -- was considered unusual at the time. Trump was never able to prove to any court that the same thing had happened to him more than a quarter century after this incident.
